item.title: CrowdStrike Named a Leader in 2025 IDC MarketScape for Worldwide Incident Response Services

item.title: MURKY PANDA: A Trusted-Relationship Threat in the Cloud
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üö® MURKY PANDA is a China-nexus adversary targeting various sectors in North America, including government and technology. Since late 2024, they have used trusted-relationship compromises in the cloud, showcasing deep knowledge of cloud environments. Their tactics include exploiting vulnerabilities and deploying malware like CloudedHope. üíª CrowdStrike has tracked MURKY PANDA‚Äôs operations, which are driven by intelligence-collection goals, often resulting in the exfiltration of sensitive‚Ä¶

Source: CrowdStrike Blog
Author: Counter Adversary Operations
Category: security_compliance

item.title: Falcon Platform Prevents COOKIE SPIDER’s SHAMOS Delivery on macOS
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üö® The CrowdStrike Falcon¬Æ platform has successfully blocked a sophisticated malware campaign by COOKIE SPIDER targeting macOS users. Between June and August 2025, over 300 customer environments were at risk due to the SHAMOS variant of the Atomic macOS Stealer. This malware was distributed through malvertising, tricking users into executing a harmful installation command. The campaign highlighted the use of one-line installation commands, which can bypass security checks, raising concerns‚Ä¶

Source: CrowdStrike Blog
Author: Maddie Stewart - Suweera De Souza - Ash Leslie - Doug Brown
Category: security_compliance

item.title: August 2025 Patch Tuesday: One Publicly Disclosed Zero-Day and 13 Critical Vulnerabilities Among 107 CVEs
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
üîí Microsoft has released its August 2025 Patch Tuesday updates, addressing 107 vulnerabilities. Among these are one publicly disclosed zero-day and 13 critical vulnerabilities. The most common risk types involve elevation of privilege (39%), remote code execution (33%), and information disclosure (15%). Windows received the largest share of patches with 67 updates. #PatchTuesday #CyberSecurity #MicrosoftUpdates #Vulnerabilities #InfoSec

Source: CrowdStrike Blog
Author: Falcon Exposure Management Team
Category: security_compliance

item.title: CrowdStrike’s Approach to Better Machine Learning Evaluation Using Strategic Data Splitting
item.dc:creator: Micha≈Ç Rutkowski
item.description:
CrowdStrike is enhancing machine learning evaluation by tackling data leakage, which can lead to inaccurate threat detection in cybersecurity. To combat this, they implement strategic data splitting during model training. This method carefully manages how data is divided, ensuring that similar data points do not skew results, ultimately leading to more reliable detection of new threats. By focusing on this strategy, CrowdStrike aims to improve the performance of their AI-native platform‚Ä¶

Source: CrowdStrike Blog
Author: Josh Sun
Category: technical_deep_dives
